Html:
I encounter some weird issue when launching my TypeScript solutions (it happens even with the default solution which comes along when creating a new TypeScript project in visual-studio). Sometimes (it happens very often), when i launch my TypeScript solution (with IE), it takes quite a while to load (i just get a blank white page for around 10-15 seconds, and after that the start page is loaded). In the output window of VS2013, i can see that the reason for that is because there was a timeout in reading few of the source-map files (image is attached)."



Does anyone knows why it happens? Ever happened to anyone? it is very annoying... :-(
Any help will be much appreciated.

I'm using Win8 / VS2013 / TS 0.9.5 / IIS Express (Just to emphasize again - it happens "just-like-that", i didn't change any config files or system configurations... I just installed VS2013 with Service Pack 1 - then installed TS 0.9.5 - then created a new TypeScript project, and i just keep getting those timeouts...)

Thanks!
Are you able to try the newest TypeScript 1.0RC and see if the issue has been fixed?

Hi,
Just tried it out with 1.0RC, i'm still struggling with this issue... seems like nothing has changed.

Thanks.
Does anyone see it as well?
